Welcome! I’m David Laing. I write to share my learning, to give more life to ideas that I think are underappreciated, and to make it easier for my future friends to find me.

The most important thing I’ve ever written is my essay, If you’re good, you need to talk more.

I write commentaries on notable essays from around the web. My favourites are on Sarah Perry’s idea of deep laziness and Alyssa Vance’s idea of levels of action.

I write about books. Most appreciated is my review of James Clear’s Atomic Habits, and most underrated is my summary of Jonathan Haidt’s The Righteous Mind.

I write about my hobbies and interests. See everything I know about chess, how to use Roam as a slip-box, and Covers shouldn’t just be for musicians.

Lastly, I write notes. I think of them as atomic proto-essays, or mega-tweets, in the style of Andy Matuschak’s evergreen notes. Here are a few notes that are on my mind:

  • The aesthetic bullseye
  • Tidy up so you can make a useful mess
  • The personal PhD
